posts.post_content: If I slap a [Grafted Exoskeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grafted Exoskeleton ) or [Tainted Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tainted Strike)/whatever on him, then start removing his counters, wil the opponent receiving the damage be hit with poison counters?
posts.html:
If I slap a Grafted Exoskeleton or Tainted Strike/whatever on him, then start removing his counters, wil the opponent receiving the damage be hit with poison counters?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: MechaKraken (2/9/2011 6:45:23 PM)
Rating:

@SarpNasty

That wouldn't work. Vigor prevents the damage and the Vampire's ability would only go off if Triskelion dealt damage. Though, it's still a board wipe combo if you need one.

@MechaKraken

Yes. Just because it's not combat damage being dealt doesn't mean that a creature's abilities aren't taken into account. A creature with lifelink, deathtouch, wither, or infect would cause you to gain life, kill creatures, leave behind -1/-1 counters, or put poison counters on a player, whenever damage is dealt, regardless of how damage is dealt.

posts.post_content:
This is a pretty damn good card in commander...  [The Mimeoplasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= The Mimeoplasm) with this plus exile [Lord of Extinction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of Extinction) after [Traumatize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Traumatize)-ing yourself is basically game over.  
  
@ PhoenixZephyrus  
  
That's absolutely not true. LoE has a characteristic-defining ability that defines it in any zone. I'll even quote you the rule:  
  
208.2a The card may have a characteristic-defining ability that sets its power and/or toughness  
according to some stated condition. (See rule 604.3.) Such an ability is worded “This  
creature’s power or toughness is equal to . . .” or “This creature’s power and toughness are  
each equal to . . .” This ability functions **everywhere**, even outside the game. If the ability needs  
to use a number that can’t be determined, including inside a calculation, use 0 instead of that  
number.
posts.html:
This is a pretty damn good card in commander... The Mimeoplasm with this plus exile Lord of Extinction after Traumatize-ing yourself is basically game over.

@ PhoenixZephyrus

That's absolutely not true. LoE has a characteristic-defining ability that defines it in any zone. I'll even quote you the rule:

208.2a The card may have a characteristic-defining ability that sets its power and/or toughness
according to some stated condition. (See rule 604.3.) Such an ability is worded “This
creature’s power or toughness is equal to . . .” or “This creature’s power and toughness are
each equal to . . .” This ability functions everywhere, even outside the game. If the ability needs
to use a number that can’t be determined, including inside a calculation, use 0 instead of that
number.

posts.post_content:
@Lyriq  
  
That doesn't work. Lord of extinction would be a 0/0 in your graveyard. It's effect is only when it's in play, not in your graveyard, and Triskelion's effect only works for Minoplasm if you choose it to be the copy and LoE as the +1/+1 counter giver. Meaning minoplasm would be... this card. You wasted your play.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Gg with Mikaeus.  
  
*In case you don't get the combo:* Have both out, Triskelion with a fresh 3 counters. Remove 1 counter to ping whatever you want, and then the last 2 to ping Triskelion itself (it's a 2/2, it has to die!). It'll pass, resurrect due to undying with an extra +1/+1 counter. Remove 2 counters, ping whatever, remove the last 2 to kill Triskelion again. Repeat until gg.
posts.html:
Gg with Mikaeus.

In case you don't get the combo: Have both out, Triskelion with a fresh 3 counters. Remove 1 counter to ping whatever you want, and then the last 2 to ping Triskelion itself (it's a 2/2, it has to die!). It'll pass, resurrect due to undying with an extra +1/+1 counter. Remove 2 counters, ping whatever, remove the last 2 to kill Triskelion again. Repeat until gg.

posts.post_content: This guy sees a lot of play in Vintage decks running [Mishra's Workshop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mishra's Workshop), because he can kill [Dark Confidant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Confidant) and a variety of other beasties, and... artifact-only decks really don't have any better options.
